travel_Bans: Temperature screenings have been introduced in Ljubljana airport and additional measures are planned for land border control. Border control has been introduced for Italy.
schools_closure: All educational institutions are closed
public_events_cancel: All public indoor events with more than 500 visitors have been banned. On 18/3-2020 all public gatherings were limited to 5 people.
Health: An army filed hospital has been deployed in Ljubljana. In addition, health professionals are prohibited from travelling abroad and their right to leave and strike is restricted
Overall_fiscal_measures: - EUR 1 billion stimulus package to mitigate the impact on the economy
Fiscal_firm: Stimulus package includes short- and long-term measures such as tax deferrals, state guarantees and credit lines. On 18/3-2020, the tax burden on business was eased with a 12 month deferral of credit payments.

quarantines: Since early march, everyone with symptoms of respiratory infection, even mild ones, was urged to avoid social contacts, both at work and in private, and throughout the country. On March 16th, the health authority (Folkhälsomyndigheten) recommeded as much as possible isolating people over 70 and working from home.
travel_Bans: No formal restriction, but on March 14th, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs advised against non-essential travel to all countries.
schools_closure: The government is recommending higher secondary schools (children aged over 16) and universities to close from March 18th. Schools for younger children are not closing at this stage.
public_events_cancel:
Relatives should avoid "unnecessary visits" to hospitals and elderly care institutions.
Events with more than 500 persons are banned since March 12th.
Overall_fiscal_measures: On march 16th, the  government presented a comprehensive package of up to SEK 300 bn (about EUR 28 bn, nearly 6% of GDP), including liquidity provisions, to deal with the economic consequences of the Covid-19 epidemic, which it intends to present to Parliament on March 19th.
Fiscal_firm:
On March 16th, the short-term layoffs scheme was introduced . Employees receive more than 90 per cent of their wages, but employers’ wage costs can be halved, thanks to the government subsidy. The subsidy level is significantly higher than in the previous short-time work scheme.
Liquidity reinforcement via tax accounts: companies can defer payment of employers’ social security contributions, preliminary tax on salaries and value added tax that are reported monthly or quarterly. Three months of tax payments can be deferred for up to 12 months. The new regulations take effect on 7 April 2020, but can be retroactively applied from 1 January 2020.
Monetary_Prudential:
On March 13th, the Riksbank has decided to lend up to SEK 500 bn (about 10% of GDP) (about €46 bn) to companies via the banks, to avoid robust companies being knocked out as a result of the spread of the coronavirus.
On March 13th, Finansinspektionen proposed to lower its countercyclical capital buffer from 2.5% percentage points to 0%. This amounts to SEK 45 bn and should create a capacity of around SEK 900 bn (about 18% of GDP) for new lending.
On March 16th, Finansinspektionen announced that it considers the loss of income associated with COVID-19 to qualify as a special reason that allows the bank and borrower to reach an agreement to reduce or suspend loan amortisation payments for a limited period of time.

quarantines:
Compulsory quarantine for incoming passengers to Turkish airports presenting coronavirus risks, irrespective of nationality (including for Turkish citizens) and compulsory quarantine for the Turkish citizens evacuated with special flights.
The authorities invite all Turkish residents returning home from travels abroad, irrespective of the countries visited, to self-impose a 14 day quarantine. They solicit their civic sense to comply with this request.
Pilmmgrims coming back from Saudi Arabia will be kept under quarantaine for two weeks. Special wards were created to this effect in emptied student residences.
travel_Bans:
Ban of all Turkish Airlines flights to and from China, South Korea, Iran, Iraq, and Italy; Total closure of land and air borders with Iran
All civil servants above 60, except special cases, will stay home until further notice. All leaves are suspended in public health services.
Flights to and from 9 EU countries are banned until 17 April (to Germany, France, Spain, Norway, Denmark, Belgium, Austria, Sweden and The Netherlands).The Minister of Tourism announced on 13 March that the government envisages asking coastal tourism resorts (which normally open for the summer season at the end of March) to postpone openings until end of April.
schools_closure: On 12 March the government announced the closure of all schools and universities for two weeks. On 12 March the government announced the closure of all schools and universities for two weeks.
public_events_cancel: Starting from 16 March libraries, discotheques and bars are closed.
Health: Daily disinfections are effected in public spaces and public transportation facilities.
Overall_fiscal_measures: The Minister of Finance and Treasury announced on 16 March that President Erdogan will announce a pckage of support measures to the economy in the course of the week (with no specific date).

quarantines: Started in northern California
travel_Bans: On 11 March, all foreign nationals on flights from China, Iran and Europe are barred entry. Americn nationals visting these places must return to designated airports
schools_closure: Urged by federal authorities in states with community transmission
public_events_cancel: Urged by federal authorities in  states with community transmissino
Health:
Of the emergency package $3 billion was for research (vaccine), over 2$ billion for prevention and response and $1 billion for medical supplies
Protection for vulnerable people: Measures to cover costs of testing for non-insured any American if a doctor deems it necessary, while Medicare Part B covers the cost of the test.
Reduction of regulatory barriers to the use of telemedicine, such as easing restrictions on reimbursement of consultations done by telephone or videoconference, which currently limit its use
Encourage home hospitalization with distance monitoring
Increased cleaning of public transportation facilities, such as metro transit, buses, boats
Consideration of the use of artificial intelligence to track the spread of the virus, give early warnings about its evolution outbreak, and predict where the virus may appear next.
Overall_fiscal_measures: Congress passed an emergency $8.3 billion spending bill
Monetary_Prudential: The FOMC lowered interest rates 100 basis points tp 0-0.25%

travel_Bans: A travel ban on foreign nationals from high-risk countries including the US, UK, China, Iran, South Korea and Italy effective March 18. South African citizens are advised to refrain from all forms of international travel through these jurisdictions effective immediately. Domestic travel is discouraged, particularly by air, rail and other forms of public transport. All forms of international government travel are prohibited.
schools_closure: Schools will be closed from Wednesday, March 18 until after the Easter holiday weekend.
public_events_cancel: Gatherings of more than 100 people are prohibited, mass gatherings are to be cancelled.
Overall_fiscal_measures: The government will make funding available to sectors that are dealing with the response to the virus. It is unclear yet whether this will be via a reprioritisation of funds or through a health Special Appropriation Bill.
Monetary_Prudential: The Monetary Policy Committee is meeting on March 19, a cut is expected.
